/home/mbuttaco/ntee/src/player_main.cpp

00001 #include "Player.hpp"
00002 #include "Error.hpp"
00003 #include <iostream>
00004 #include <string>
00005 #include <cstring>
00006 
00011 int main(int argc, char** argv) 
00012 {
00013    std::string USAGE(
00014      "Usage: ntee_player [-h] <--client|--server> <host> <port> <datafile>\n");
00015    std::string HELP(
00016      "Purpose: Acts as either a client or server program and plays back\n"
00017      "         canned data from the input data file.\n"
00018      "\n"
00019      "Arguments:\n"
00020      "  --client     Causes the playback program to act like a client,\n"
00021      "                connecting on the <host> and <port> address. Once\n"
00022      "                a connection is established, the program will play\n"
00023      "                client data read from the input file.\n"
00024      "  --server     Causes the playback program to act like a server,\n"
00025      "                listening on <host> and <port> and once a connection\n"
00026      "                is made, playing back server messages from the input\n"
00027      "                data file.\n"
00028      "  <host>       Symbolic or IP address to start socket on\n"
00029      "  <port>       Integer number of port to utilize when running\n"
00030      "  <datafile>   NTee output file which defines the message data to\n"
00031      "                be played back with.\n"
00032      "\n"
00033      "NOTE:\n"
00034      "  Argument ordering is important and should exactly follow the usage\n"
00035      "  statement (ie. --client or --server must be first followed by <host>,\n"
00036      "  <port>, and <datafile> arguments.  The help option must be the first\n"
00037      "  option supplied.\n" );
00038    
00039    // handle case where we have no arguments given
00040    ErrIf( argc < 2 ).info(USAGE);
00041    
00042    // At least one argument is present. Is it -h, --client, --server 
00043    // or is it something else?
00044    Player::Config pc;
00045    if ( ! strcmp(argv[1],"-h") || ! strcmp(argv[1],"--help") ) {
00046       std::cerr << USAGE << HELP;
00047       return(0);
00048    }
00049    else if ( strcmp(argv[1],"--client") == 0 ) 
00050       pc.type = Player::Config::CLIENT;
00051    else if ( strcmp(argv[1],"--server") == 0 )
00052       pc.type = Player::Config::SERVER;
00053    else
00054       ErrIf( argv[1] ).info("First arg must be either -h, --client, or --server...\n%s\n",
00055                             USAGE.c_str());
00056 
00057    // handle case where too few options are provided
00058    ErrIf( argc < 5 ).info("Too few arguments...\n%s\n",USAGE.c_str());
00059 
00060 
00061    // Grab the other args    
00062    pc.host = argv[2];
00063    pc.port = argv[3];
00064    pc.file = argv[4];
00065 
00066    // Create and configure the player
00067    Player p( pc );
00068    
00069    // Cause connection 
00070    return p.start();   
00071 }
